resources.string: "If you like my game, please take a moment to rate it and consider buying the donation version.

Shinro is a logic puzzle game played on an eight by eight grid. The objective is to find the twelve hidden points by using the numbers at the top and left of every column and row, respectively, and the arrows inside the grid. 

The general strategy is to look for simple moves first. Start by ruling out any spaces which could not contain a point. Then, look for arrow paths which contain only one possible space in which to place a point. Sometimes individual arrows are not enough to locate the next point. In those cases, combinations of arrows must be considered. 

Each arrow points to AT LEAST one hidden point. However, arrows may point to multiple hidden points and not all hidden points are necessarily pointed to by any arrow. 

Tap any empty space one time to place a point. Xs may also be placed to mark spaces which have been ruled out. Tap any point once or any empty space twice to place an X. Tapping the X again will clear the space. 

At the top of every column and to the left of every row is a number represented by a group of zero to eight pips. Please note that rows or columns headed by an empty space where a number should be have zero hidden points in that row or column. 

You may tap the number to fill every empty space in that column or row with an X. Tap the number again to remove all Xs from that column or row. 

As you fill in hidden points in a row or column, the individual pips in the number will become highlighted. If you place more points than there are hidden in a given row or column, the header number will turn red. 

The spaces in line with an arrow may be highlighted for convenience by tapping the arrow. Tap the arrow again to unhighlight the line of spaces.
